intro: Dicranopteris nuda, commonly known as the naked fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, slender fronds that are typically unbranched and have a smooth, glossy surface. The plant produces small, inconspicuous spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its leaves. Dicranopteris nuda is native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and reproductive features make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
